info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 1:01PM PST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSNOW WITH GUSTY WINDS AND THE POTENTIAL FOR POOR VISIBILITY TONIGHT... A strong winter weather system will move into the area tonight. A rain/snow mix will change to all snow behind the front. Winds will be strong both ahead of and behind the front, with gusts to 40 mph possible. In addition, there is enough instability in the atmosphere to support strong showers and even a thunderstorm. Therefore we strongly urge caution if you are traveling in the Treasure Valley between 8 PM MST and 4 AM MST. The earlier time is when the Lower Treasure Valley sees the threat begin, with the Upper Treasure threat starting around 10 PM MST. The threat ends in the Lower Treasure Valley between 2 and 3 AM MST, and extends through to 4 AM MST in the Upper Treasure Valley. There will be brief periods of near-whiteout conditions in the stronger showers or any thunderstorms that form, but most folks won`t experience much worse than around 1/2 visibility with brief heavy snow and gusts to 30 mph.
